summary: CLINTON claims that she worked hard to establish and enforce agreements, specifically mentioning her work with the President. This claim was made during a Democratic debate in New Hampshire on February 4th, 2016.

During the Democratic debate in New Hampshire on February 4th, 2016, Senator Sanders claimed that millions of Americans are losing faith in the political process because they believe the economy is rigged. He argued that people are working longer hours for low wages, are concerned about their children's future, and are frustrated that the majority of new income and wealth is going to the top 1 percent.

SANDERS claims during the Democratic debate in New Hampshire on February 4th, 2016, that he is running for president because he believes it is too late for establishment politics and economics. He supports his claim by highlighting the lack of guaranteed healthcare, paid family and medical leave, high childhood poverty rates, and the inability of many families to afford college in the United States.
CLINTON claimed in the last sentence that she never said she does not see Senator Sanders as a president.
CLINTON claimed in the last sentence that she never said she does not see Senator Sanders as a president.
